question_text: An 18-year-old man is evaluated for a second episode of nephrolithiasis.Urinalysis results are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely composition of this patient's kidney stones?
critique: Cystine stones (Option B) are a relatively uncommon type of stone and result from cystinuria, an autosomal recessive disease. Patients commonly present in childhood or adolescence. The diagnosis should be suspected in young patients with recurrent nephrolithiasis or with a strong family history of nephrolithiasis. Cystine stones are recognized by pathognomonic hexagonal crystals in the urine. They may also form staghorn calculi and are less radio-opaque than calcium-containing stones.
